titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 60: Baḥr al-ʻUyūn.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 60: Baḥr al-ʻUyūn. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Columbia University, Rare Book & Manuscript Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 60: Baḥr al-ʻUyūn.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: On magic, including sīmiyā and rīmiyā. This work closely resembles Kāshifī's Asrār-i Qāsimī, also called Siḥr al-ʻUyūn.

supportDesc.extent: 75 paginated leaves : 230 x 155 (180 x 110) mm, bound to 240 x 160 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary pagination in Hindu-Arabic numerals in black ink, upper center.

layoutDesc.layout: 17 long lines with some symbols and diagrams.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink, pointed.

decoNote: Rubrications in red. Some diagrams and symbols in black and red.

binding.p: Red half leather binding with green marbled paper sides.

origin.p: Item is undated and the colophon is scrubbed; likely produced in 19th century India.
